alert.note: Alert for Florence (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 10:24AM CDT until May 09 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Green Bay WI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan...Wisconsin... Menominee River near Florence affecting Florence, Dickinson and Iron Counties. Menominee River near McAllister affecting Marinette and Menominee Counties. For the Menominee River...including Florence, McAllister...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NEXT TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Menominee River near Florence. * WHEN...Until next Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Flooding is confined to lowland and wooded land. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 9.1 feet this afternoon, then fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. It will then rise above flood stage again early Saturday morning, reaching 9.2 feet early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.
